questions.question_text: You are using the Vault userpass auth method mounted at auth/userpass. How do you create a new user named "sally" with password "h0wN0wB4r0wnC0w"? This new user will need the power-users policy.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct, https://developer.hashicorp.com/vault/docs/auth/userpass#configuration.

questions.question_text: What command creates a secret with the key "my-password" and the value "53cr3t" at path "my-secrets" within the KV secrets engine mounted at "secret"?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
root@templatevm:~# vault kv put secret/my-secrets my-passw ord=53cret
===== Secret Path =====
secret/data/my-secrets

======= Metadata =======
Key Value
--- -----
created_time 2025-04-08T12:10:27.918814027Z
custom_metadata <nil>
deletion_time n/a
destroyed false
version 1

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D, the dash '-' should be an equals sign '=' though

Answer is A wrong. 
 vault kv put secret/my-secret/my-password test
Failed to parse K=V data: invalid key/value pair "test": format must be key=value

vault kv put secret/my-secret/my-password user=test

I have tested on my local machine.
Thanks

comments.content: The answer is D with modification vault kv put secret/my-secret password=53cr3t

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The right command to create a key is 'vault kv put', the path to our new key is "secret/my-secrets/my-password" and it's value is "53cr3t". A has the correct syntax per https://developer.hashicorp.com/vault/docs/commands/kv#examples in the documentation.

questions.question_text: What can be used to limit the scope of a credential breach?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Short-lived dynamic secrets are generated on demand and have an automatic expiration time, reducing the risk of long-term credential exposure. If a breach occurs, the stolen credentials become useless once they expire.

choices.A: Storage of secrets in a distributed ledger
choices.C: Use of a short-lived dynamic secrets

questions.question_text: What environment variable overrides the CLIâ€™s default Vault server address?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
he VAULT_ADDR environment variable is used to override the default Vault server address in the CLI. It specifies the URL of the Vault server, including the protocol (http or https) and port.

Selected Answer: A
VAULT_ADDR is the correct environment variable.

Selected Answer: B
B. You will be prompted to enter the password

Selected Answer: B
As shown here https://developer.hashicorp.com/vault/docs/auth/ldap#authentication you will be prompted to enter the password for mitchellh.

choices.C: By default, the generated token is valid for 24 hours
choices.B: You will be prompted to enter the password
choices.A: Generates a token which is response wrapped
choices.D: Fails because the password is not provided

$ vault login -method=ldap username=mitchellh
